section.name: What Is James IMAP?
section.p: A library providing a flexible codec for IMAP, command processors and a sample data access layer.
In combination with a socket layer, and a mailbox persistence, this library can be used to create an IMAP server.

section.name: Status
section.p: RFC2060 is functionally complete, tested and usable. The data access layer is still under optimization on performance perspectives. Database schema and API changes are susceptible to change.

section.name: IMAP in James Server
section.p: JAMES Server 3 supports IMAP (using this library). A backport to James Server 2.3.2 would require a volunteer.

section.name: Use James IMAP as a component in you application
section.p: The source code page contains information on how to develop on James IMAP.
